DOC.brief_summary: PF-04620110 is a novel compound proposed for the treatment of Type 2 diabetes mellitus. The primary purpose of this trial is to evaluate the safety and tolerability, and pharmacodynamics, of multiple oral doses of PF-04620110 in T2DM patients.
DOC.brief_title: A Multiple Dose Study Of PF-04620110 In Type 2 Diabetes Patients
DOC.criteria: Male and/or female subjects between the ages of 18 and 60 years; Body Mass Index (BMI) of >25.0 kg/m2 and <40 kg/m2; Subjects must have a historical diagnosis of T2DM in accordance with the ADA guidelines; Subjects who have been on welltolerated and stable doses of metformin Recent evidence (6 months prior to screening) or history of unstable major organ disease; Diagnosis of Type 1 diabetes mellitus; Current medical history of myocardial infarction, unstable angina, or history of stroke (including TIA) within 6 months prior to Screening; Treatment with thiazolidinediones (TZDs), or subcutaneously administered antidiabetic agents;
DOC.keyword: multiple dose study in type 2 diabetes patients
